page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY-KELHAM
page.content: Kelham Hall is a Victorian Mansion of local history importance.It is an impressive landmark in the Trent Valley.It was designed by George Gilbert Scott.It is now the Headqua- rters of Newark District Council.The reception area,originally the carriage court accommodates Reception Personnel,telephonists and a secretar- ial support group.The "cloisters" pro- vide private interview areas.The Hall is used on a variety of social occas- ions and meetings.It is a tourist attraction with it's patterned floors and ornate wall decorations.The domed chapel has herringbone brickwork and a"flying archway." Kelham church is in the grounds of Kelham Hall.It has been subject to vandalism and theft.Much renovation is needed to maintain the structure.Fund raising is essential.
